results.title: Chemical engineering
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The chemical engineer applies engineering principles for chemical purposes, and works with the chemist and mechanical engineer. The design, erection and economical operation of chemical plants is his responsibility. He may have to analyse much data and prepare reports on plant operation. His grasp of maths must be strong and the computer is one of his tools. The university course indicates the wide field covered by his training.
results.description:

results.title: Catering and hotel management
results.creator_credit: Mutual Life and Citizens' Assurance Co. and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Good catering entails the management and supervision of staff, and the bulk ordering and preparation of food. The various applications of this work in hospitals, canteens and hotels demonstrates the degree of skilled knowledge which is required.

results.title: Building trades
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A vocational guidance film showing the work of tradesmen in the construction of a house, an office block or a factory, including bricklayers, plasterers, tilers and carpenters. Discusses careers available to building tradesmen as supervisors or in their own building companies.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A vocational guidance film showing the work of tradesmen in the construction of a house, an office block or a factory, including bricklayers, plasterers, tilers and carpenters. Discusses careers available to building tradesmen as supervisors or in their own building companies.
description_for_label:

results.title: Architecture
results.creator_credit: Citizen's Assurance, Mutual Life and Citizens' Assurance Co. and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The architect is trained to understand the needs of people and how labour, machines and materials can create buildings which meet these needs. Although he may arrange for the help of special experts such as structural or lighting engineers he too must have a grasp of these technical matters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Citizen’s Assurance, Mutual Life and Citizens’ Assurance Co. and Career Productions

results.title: Advertising
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Explores the structure of an advertising agency, looking at the roles of account executives, researchers, commercial artists, copywriters, photographers, production and media planners. By following the process of an advertising campaign, the skills and collaboration required within each section of an agency are highlighted.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.

results.title: Introduction to Psychology
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: Just an accident
group_works.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University

results.title: Just an accident
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to Psychology”.
Concerned with the experimental investigation of human factors in road accident causation. Considers individual differences in hazard perception, the problem of where the driver pays attention within the visual field, and how the driver deals with a hazard which has been seen.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to Psychology”.
Concerned with the experimental investigation of human factors in road accident causation. Considers individual differences in hazard perception, the problem of where the driver pays attention within the visual field, and how the driver deals with a hazard which has been seen.
description_for_label:

group_siblings.title: What psychologists do (TEFC)
group_siblings.creator_credit: Carol Haslam and Open University

results.title: What psychologists do (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to Psychology”.
John Annett looks at work being done by six psychologists in the following areas: acquisition of reading skills, computer assisted learning, vocational guidance, design of industrial machine tools, diagnosis of brain damage, work with chronic, mute schizophrenics. He points out the close relationship between psychological research and its application to real life problems.
